action.action-desc: Mr. Williams of Texas introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to terminate certain production and investment tax credits for wind, solar, and battery energy storage, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stop the Subsidized Green Energy Scam Act.

section.header: Termination of tax credits for wind, solar, and battery energy storage

subsection.text: Section 48(a)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking the period at the end and inserting , or any facility the construction of which begins after the date of the enactment of the Stop the Subsidized Green Energy Scam Act if such facility uses wind, solar energy, or battery energy storage to generate, store, or deliver electricity.

paragraph.text: Section 45Y(b)(1) of such Code is amended by redesignating subparagraph (D) as subparagraph (E) and by inserting after subparagraph (C) the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.header: Termination of credit for wind, solar, and battery facilities
subparagraph.text: The term qualified facility shall not include any facility the construction of which begins after the date of the enactment of the Stop the Subsidized Green Energy Scam Act if such facility uses wind, solar energy, or battery energy storage to generate, store, or deliver electricity.

paragraph.text: Section 45Y(g)(11)(C)(ii) of such Code is amended by inserting and at the end of subclause (I), by striking the comma at the end of subclause (II) and inserting a period, and by striking subclauses (III), (IV), and (V).

subsection.text: Section 48E(b)(3) of such Code is amended by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.header: Termination of credit for wind, solar, and battery facilities
subparagraph.text: The term qualified facility shall not include any facility the construction of which begins after the date of the enactment of the Stop the Subsidized Green Energy Scam Act if such facility uses wind, solar energy, or battery energy storage to generate, store, or deliver electricity.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to property the construction of which begins after the date of the enactment of this Act.
